Package group10.server.controller

Class PlayerController

java.lang.Object
group10.server.controller.PlayerController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/user") public class PlayerController extends Object
Author:
Alperen Caykus, Mustafa Ozan Alpay REST Endpoint class for Players. All requests that are sent to /api/user is handled by this class

  • Method Details

    • get

      @GetMapping("") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> get()
      HTTP GET requests to "" path are served by this method. Gets data of the player that sent the request Logs the username of the user that sent the request to standard out.
      Returns:
      Player
      See Also:
      Player

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> login​(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid LoginDTO loginData)
      HTTP POST requests to "/login" path are served by this method. Logs the username that is present in the request body to standard out.
      Parameters:
      loginData - Login form that contains login credentials
      Returns:
      HTTP200 Token on success. HTTP 5xx on error.

    • register

      @PostMapping("/register") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> register​(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid PlayerDTO user)
      HTTP POST requests to "/register" path are served by this method. Logs the email that is present in the request body to standard out.
      Parameters:
      user - Player that is going to be registered.
      Returns:
      HTTP200 Player data on success. HTTP 5xx on error.

    • requestPwCode

      @PostMapping("/requestPwCode") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> requestPwCode​(@RequestBody String email)
      HTTP POST requests to "/requestPwCode" path are served by this method. Logs the email address that the code is going to be sent to standard out.
      Parameters:
      email - Email address that the password reset code is sent to.
      Returns:
      HTTP200true if mail is sent successfully, HTTP200 false otherwise

    • updatePassword

      @PutMapping("/updatePassword") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updatePassword​(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid PasswordResetDTO passwordResetDTO)
      HTTP POST requests to "/updatePassword" path are served by this method. Logs the username sent by the client.
      Parameters:
      passwordResetDTO - Data that is sent by the client to reset their password.
      Returns:
      HTTP200 true if successfully updated, HTTP200 false otherwise.
      See Also:
      PasswordResetDTO
